dressed me in an audible whisper – I am sa
tisfied, miserable wretch, you have
determined to live & I am satisfied – I darted
towards the place from which the sound
proceeded but the ^devil eluded my grasp.
suddenly the broard disk of the moon
arose and shone fully upon
his ghastly & distorted shape, as he fled with
more than
mortal speed.

I persued ^him;– & for many months this
pursuit has been my task. Guided by a slight clue
I followed the windings of the Rhone
but vainly – The mediterranean appeared
and by a strange chance I saw the fiend
enter by night & hide himself in a vessel
bound for the black sea – I followed him
I knew the
vessel in which
he was concealed
& he escaped me
I know not
how.
Amidst the wilds of Tartary &
Russia although he still evaded me
I have ever followed in his track – Some
times the peasants scared by his horrid
Apparition informed me of his path
Sometimes he himself who feared that
if I lost all trace I should despair & die
often left some mark to guide me –The
snows descended on my head & I saw the print
of his huge step on the white plain –To
you are fast enterring on life, & care is new to you &X how can
you understand what I have felt & still feel.
Cold, want & ^fatigue were the least pains
which I was
destined to endure;
I was cursed by some devil & bore about
with me my eternal Hell – Yet still a
spirit of good followed & directed my steps
